headline.main: ARRIVAL OF THE STAR OF THE WEST; Large Discoveries of Gold in the British Possessions. Treaty Between France and the Sandwich Islands. docs.abstract: Case of Gov. Pen. Johnston in Cal
docs.lead_paragraph: The United States Mail steamship Star of the West, A. G. GRAY, Commander, from Aspinwall on May 4, with the California mails of April 20, passengers, and $1,615,351 94 in treasure, arrived at this port yesterday morning. The Pacific Mail Steamship Company's steamer Golden Age, with the California mails, Passengers and treasure, arrived at Panama on the night of the 3d inst.

docs.snippet: ARRIVAL OF THE PHILADELPHIA--CONTINUED OUTRAGES BY BRITISH VESSELS OF WAR. The United States mail steamship Philadelphia, GUSTAVUS HARRISON commanding, left New Orleans on the 5th inst., arrived at Havana at sunrise of the 8th, and sailed again at 9...
docs.lead_paragraph: ARRIVAL OF THE PHILADELPHIA--CONTINUED OUTRAGES BY BRITISH VESSELS OF WAR. The United States mail steamship Philadelphia, GUSTAVUS HARRISON commanding, left New Orleans on the 5th inst., arrived at Havana at sunrise of the 8th, and sailed again at 9 A. M. of the 9th for NewYork.

docs.snippet: Miss Elizabeth Dye, a young lady in Newport, Ky., personated Louisiana in a Know-Nothing celebration in the campaign of '56, when a tableaux of the States of the Union formed a part of certain jubilee ceremonies; and for the excellent manner in which...
docs.lead_paragraph: Miss Elizabeth Dye, a young lady in Newport, Ky., personated Louisiana in a Know-Nothing celebration in the campaign of '56, when a tableaux of the States of the Union formed a part of certain jubilee ceremonies; and for the excellent manner in which she performed that somewhat conspicuous service, has received a present of a magnificent diamond bracelet from the grateful K. N.'s of New-Orleans.

headline.main: FROM WASHINGTON.; The New Territory of Nevada--Its Extent, Boundaries and Character--Reasons for its Organization, &c.--The New Volunteer Regiments.

docs.lead_paragraph: I telegraphed you last week that the House Committee on Territories were about to report a bill for the organization of a new Territory, called Nevada, out of the western portion of Utah-one of your enterprising cotemporaries had the news in his telegraphic columns two or three days afterwards.

docs.snippet: DEATH OF ADMIRAL CARDEN.-Americans were at one time deeply interested in the fate of this gallant officer, though his name is now scarcely remembered or known in the United States. He it was who commanded the Macedonia (48) in 1812, when, after a...
docs.lead_paragraph: DEATH OF ADMIRAL CARDEN.-Americans were at one time deeply interested in the fate of this gallant officer, though his name is now scarcely remembered or known in the United States. He it was who commanded the Macedonia (48) in 1812, when, after a stubborn resistance, which brought the ship to ahopcless wreck, she was compelled to surrender to the United States. headline.main: LETTERS OF THE DEAD.; A STRANGE STORY.

docs.lead_paragraph: There are few who have reached the age of twenty-five that have not stores of such treasures. And we all have days of looking over these eloquent mementoes of our beloved dead. How mourntul they are ; with what a louching, though voiceless cty. do they move their hearts. even when we know that the life of the dear writer was gladness, and his death peace.

headline.main: WASHINGTON GOSSIP.; The Banker and the Secretary of Legation --The Medical Congress--Another Violation of the Code of Ethics--Weddings at Georgetown--Death of Senator Evans--Children's Fancy Ball--College Exhibition--Theatrical--Ebony Saxhorn Band--Marketing--With Arabelia's Opinions.

docs.lead_paragraph: The commencement of hostilities between the United States and Spain, as recorded in my last Saturday's revue de la semaine, has naturally attracted the attention of the metropolitan gossips, and the less delicate and less truthful chronicles in other New-York papers have but added fuel to the flame.

docs.snippet: In the Senate yesterday, a communication was received from the War Department on the subject of purchasing a site for a fort at the Golden Gate, near San Francisco. It has a ranch, or farm, and the proposed price is $200,000. Mr. BRODERICK said it...
docs.lead_paragraph: In the Senate yesterday, a communication was received from the War Department on the subject of purchasing a site for a fort at the Golden Gate, near San Francisco. It has a ranch, or farm, and the proposed price is $200,000. Mr. BRODERICK said it was not worth over $7,000.

headline.main: INTERESTING FROM CHINA.; Movements of the American East India Squadron--Visit of the San Jacinto to Manilla--The Approaching Conferences at Shanghae--Affairs at Canton--The Demands of the Four Powers Forwarded to Pekin.

docs.lead_paragraph: I informed you, in my last letter, that we were about to leave for Manila. We left for the above-named place on the 7th of February last, having male a fine run of about 85 hours, stopping in the meantime for some six hours to fire at target with shot and shell. At Manila we exchanged the usual salutes.
